## Questions
1. Create two character vectors of length 3. Create a new combined vector EXCLUDING (without) the second elements of both vectors. (1 pt)
```{r}
# create two vectors
char_vec1 <- c("A", "B", "C")
char_vec2 <- c("Q", "W", "E")

# Method 1
vec_comb_1 <- c(char_vec1[1], char_vec1[3], char_vec2[1], char_vec2[3])
vec_comb_1

# Method 2
vec_comb_2 <- c(char_vec1[-2], char_vec2[-2])
vec_comb_2
```


2. Create a vector of all multiples of 7 between 10 and 100 in DECREASING order? (1 pt)
```{r}
# Method 1
vec_mult_7 <- seq(from = 98, to = 10, by = -7)
vec_mult_7

# Method 2
vec_num_100_10 <- seq(from = 100, to = 10, by = -1)
vec_num_100_10

mod7 <- vec_num_100_10 %% 7 # Find the modulo of 7
mod7
log_mod7 <- mod7 == 0 # Find which elements are divisible by 7 and create a logical vector
log_mod7
vec_num_100_10[log_mod7] # Use the logical vector to subset 

# Combined method 2
vec_num_100_10[vec_num_100_10 %% 7 == 0]
vec_num_100_10[vec_num_100_10 %% 17 == 0]

# Don't do this
(100:10)[(100:10) %% 7 == 0]
```


3. Create any 3x3 numeric matrix. Create a vector of sums of elements in each column using two different methods. (2 pts)
```{r}
num_mat <- matrix(data = 1:9, nrow = 3) # Create a numeric matrix
num_mat

# Method 1
sum_vec1 <- sum(num_mat[, 1])
sum_vec2 <- sum(num_mat[, 2])
sum_vec3 <- sum(num_mat[, 3])

c(sum_vec1, sum_vec2, sum_vec3)
c(sum(num_mat[, 1]), sum(num_mat[, 2]), sum(num_mat[, 3]))

# Method 2 (DataCamp)
colSums(num_mat)
#rowSums()

# Method 3
num_mat
num_mat[1, ]
num_mat[2, ]
num_mat[1, ] + num_mat[2, ]
num_mat[1, ] + num_mat[2, ] + num_mat[3, ]
```


4. Create a named numeric vector of numbers 1 through 6. The names of elements of this vector should be A through F. (1 pt)
```{r}
num_vec <- 1:6
names(num_vec) <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F")
# names(num_vec) <- c(A, B, C, D, E, F)
num_vec

LETTERS
letters

num_vec
```


5. & 6. Create the following vectors using `rep` function (1 pt each)
![](Q5.png)
```{r}
# Method 1
rep(x = c("A", "C", "B"), each = 4)
rep(x = c("A", "C", "B"), times = 4) # This is wrong

# Method 2
c(rep(x = "A", times = 4), rep(x = "C", times = 4), rep(x = "B", times = 4))

# Method 3
rep(x = c("A", "C", "B"), times = c(4, 4, 4))
rep(x = c("A", "C", "B"), times = rep(x = 4, times = 3))

```


![](Q6.png)
```{r}
rep(x = c("A", "1", "TRUE"), times = 4)

rep(x = c("A", 1, TRUE), times = 4) # c() function coerces all the elements to be character elements

rep(x = c("A", "1", "TRUE", " "), times = 4)
```
